alert.note: Alert for Upper Gunnison River Valley; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 1:28PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Gunnison County through 215 PM MDT... At 127 PM MDT, Doppler radar and satellite imagery were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pitkin, or 22 miles east of Gunnison, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail possible. SOURCE...Radar and satellite indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Gunnison County, including the following locations... Parlin, Waunita Hot Spgs and Ohio. This includes U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 168 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Upper Gunnison River Valley; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains
